item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one’s own self." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Alfred Tennyson
item.description: "I am a part of all that I have met." -- Alfred Tennyson

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Love is how you stay alive, even after you are gone." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Daniel Defoe
item.description: "It is never too late to be wise." -- Daniel Defoe

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Niccolò Machiavelli
item.description: "Everyone sees what you appear to be, few experience what you really are." -- Niccolò Machiavelli

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Amelia Earhart
item.description: "Adventure is worthwhile in itself." -- Amelia Earhart

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Sherwood Anderson
item.description: "Dare to be strong and courageous. That is the road. Venture anything." -- Sherwood Anderson
